item.title: Bit Risky
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:26, topic:373139”][quote author=IlikeArrays link=topic=469155.msg3430663#msg3430663 date=1292298936]

They wouldn’t look at his ip for woodcutting next to a mod.

I mean, he’s been reset once, and he just provided proof of himsef botting, but they wouldn’t watch someone’s ip for no reason.
[/quote]When you get reported, they watch you man. if he keeps botting on that ip theyll reset all of his accounts

lol, why in the world would they watch you? 500 employees to 200,000 players. Yea like they would watch you. Their bot protection is done by code, eliminating the waste of money to hire people to watch screens all day.

^^This.

They are a business, why would they throw money down the drain hiring extra manpower to survey suspected accounts.[/quote]

In all honesty the players should come first, not money. Jagex have gained a bad reputation towards probably 90% of the audience (4k compliments, 188k rants lol).

Although people moan about bots and updates not suiting them (this includes me, it gets very frustrating when a big change happens), yet people still DO play - maybe not as much people, but even if we moan, we do.

I’m trying to go somewhere with this, but I forgot my point, so I’m going to go bed.

Read full topic

item.title: Bit Risky
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“abatssk8ter, post:13, topic:373139”]Ahahah, he caught ya. never bot on that account or ip again better get a vps

[quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=469155.msg3430257#msg3430257 date=1292279471]
Even though he’s an Moderator; it’s not going to make much of an difference. He doesn’t have some kind of special powers to know whom is botting and whom is not.
[/quote] a report from a player moderator is going to be looked at more thoroughly then a regular report for macroing.[/quote]

I came to check on the computer and noticed he must of been talking to someone about botting, I then said I got my chat off just in case I got reported from a moderator, just to save some hassle. He never caught me, just left me alone and I carried on.

Was just showing me botting next to a moderator, as it is a bit risky but what can they do? Nothing.

nacional:

13k xp an hour only? specially woodcutting that’s really bad

This is because I’m on a 28k dialup and keep disconnecting. Plus the bot kept clicking next to the Soul Wars portal. I can have a 12 hour proggy, with only 100 logs cut, because it crashes an hour after I’ve gone to bed, lol.

Read full topic

item.description:

They wouldn’t look at his ip for woodcutting next to a mod.

I mean, he’s been reset once, and he just provided proof of himsef botting, but they wouldn’t watch someone’s ip for no reason.
[/quote]When you get reported, they watch you man. if he keeps botting on that ip theyll reset all of his accounts
[/quote]Are you a JaGeX employee? Do you know one? No, so dont act like you know how they act.

Lets say an average of 100k people on daily, and only 1% gets reported. Thats 1k people a day. They dont have the time or money to watch that many people.[/quote]it’s just common sense, read there posts.

item.title: Bit Risky
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=abatssk8ter link=topic=469155.msg3430514#msg3430514 date=1292290970]
Ahahah, he caught ya. never bot on that account or ip again better get a vps

Even though he’s an Moderator; it’s not going to make much of an difference. He doesn’t have some kind of special powers to know whom is botting and whom is not.
[/quote] a report from a player moderator is going to be looked at more thoroughly then a regular report for macroing.

What the fuck does a VPS have anything to do with botting?

And why the hell can’t he bot on that IP?

They won’t watch him because he was botting.

As far as I’m aware, they have no system to detect who is using a bot client.

They only have methods of detecting repeating methods, (certain scripts), which generally result in a Random Event.

I see why a moderator’s report would be looked at more thoroughly, than a normal player, but Moderators have no affect on a player’s punishment.

They can only mute people for a temporary time. JaGeX employees must review their punishment, and see if applicable to stay, or be lifted.[/quote]Are you serious? of course they watch peoples ips.

Read full topic
